result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary W. Dahl

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Attorney Niemeier

ADDRESS INFO for Gary W. Dahl
Current: 306 S. Main Street, Blair, WI 54616 United States  (Effective: 11-22-2016)
Prior: 306 S Main St, Blair, WI 54616

Defendant appears in person with counsel Rick Niemeier.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  He will plea to Count 1 of 16CT100 with Count 2 being DRI and 16CM140 will be DRI.  The 2 civil citations, 15TR3981 & 15TR3982, are also to be DRI.  It's a joint recommendation for 18 months probation with a fine including costs of $2122.00; 45 days jail, with all but first 14 days stayed; Alcohol assessment & Driver Safety Plan, IID, DL revocation; and conditions of probation of not to consume any alcohol or be where sold, served or available for consumption; AODA assessment and must comply with all recommendations.  Court reviews charge and potential penalties.  Plea to Count 1 -  No Contest.  Court reviews priors listed in complaint with defendant and attorney Niemeier states his client knows he has 2 prior convictions but isn't sure of the specific dates.  They are not subject to collateral attack per attorney Niemeier.  Court reviews the plea questionnaire/waiver of rights with the defendant and his counsel.  Defense stipulates to the factual basis in the complaint for the plea.  Court finds he knowingly, freely, voluntarily, and intelligently enters his plea and waives his rights; a factual basis exists; finding of guilty on Count 1 with count 2 dismissed.  16CM140 is dismissed and read-in; also 15TR3981 and 15TR3982 are dismissed and read-in.  Joint recommendation for sentencing.  Atty Niemeier states his client was recently released from in-patient treatment.  Defendant does not make any statements to the Court.  Court adopts the joint recommendation and withholds sentence and places defendant on 18  months probation with conditions of probation:  45 days jail with all but first 14 days stayed pending successful completion of probation , COMPAS and must comply with any recommendations, including alcohol assessment and any recommended treatment/programming, Driver Safety Plan, must not consume any alcohol or be where sold or served, subject to random alcohol testing, fine and costs for a total of $2122, IID 24 months and DL is revoked 24 months.  Must sign releases for agent to monitor progress of terms of probation.  Defense requests jail to commence on 1-15-17 by 6:00 p.m.  May serve in Trempealeau County if arrangements can be made and is stayed until 1-15-17, but may serve sooner if possible. Any violation prior to that date, the stay is lifted and must serve sentence immediately.  Must submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.  DNA submission form given to defendant in court.
Transmittal letter with ORGA from attorney Rick Niemeier
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
STC canceled and set for PLEAS at request of Atty Niemeier on all cases.
From City Attorney Lisa Hirschman to Judge authorizing the DA to resolve the civil citations with his criminal cases 15CT100 and 16CM140
from Attorney Niemeier

Pre-trial conference on October 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 24, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Niemeier.  Waive reading of the complaint.  NGP entered.  PTC set for 10/5 and STC 10/24 at 3:00 pm.  Track all.  NGP entered on citations.  Bond continued.
Defendant's
from Attorney Niemeier
defendant called wanted to know if we were coming to pick him up for court on Monday; he stated he was in a nursing home now; gave him his attorney's name # for him to call.
Copies of OACL to both attorney (& copies of complaints) and defendant.  Also sent payment plan to defendant.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Sent to Judge
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  Court advised the defendant of his attorney options.  Fill out Petition for appointment of counsel.  AIA set for 9/12 at 9 am.  Must book on 16CM140.  Tr's to track.
SPD Eligibility Worksheet - not eligible

defendant called informed him to call PD office; he knew he has court 8/29/16 he asked if he had to be here;yes if he needs to fax some documentation told him to do so but to call PD he had Ms Sebion previously
Adjourned initial appearance on August 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Attorney Sebion spoke to the court.  She represents him in another county.  He does not qualify for SPD in Jackson County.  State requests a warrant.  Reset to 8/29.  Attorney Sebion will let DA's office know the defendant's status.  Track TR's

Per Arin - Gerald is going to serve the defendant on Monday when he appears on another case.  Didn't know if it should be scheduled for INIT.  I spoke to Gerald and he said to set for INIT on 8-15-16.
